let’s equip it.

string.ID: This is an artifact beyond simple understanding. Try examining it.

string.ID: The whole game world is a series of contiguous maps. Our passage continues off screen. Let's follow it. Walk north.

quests.string: The whole game world is a series of contiguous maps. Our passage continues off screen. Let's follow it. Walk north.

string.ID:
Oh! it looks like Warden Yrame killed Mehmet. Why, you ask?
Well, named creatures who you can perform the water ritual with, like Mehmet, generate with dynamic faction relationships. In your game, Mehmet must have been hated by the Fellowship of Wardens for some reason.
string.Value:
Oh! it looks like Warden Yrame killed Mehmet. Why, you ask?
Well, named creatures who you can perform the water ritual with, like Mehmet, generate with dynamic faction relationships. In your game, Mehmet must have been hated by the Fellowship of Wardens for some reason.

string.ID:
And so Warden Yrame took her revenge. In Qud, sometimes even our best efforts at providing a safe starter village are foiled by the simulation!
What a charmed run! It's quite rare for this to happen, but now you get to see this hidden section of the tutorial. Good job.
string.Value:
And so Warden Yrame took her revenge. In Qud, sometimes even our best efforts at providing a safe starter village are foiled by the simulation!
What a charmed run! It's quite rare for this to happen, but now you get to see this hidden section of the tutorial. Good job.

string.ID:
You have a few options now. You can roll with it and continue in this world where Mehmet's been revenge-slain. The early game will be a bit harder, but the main quest is not impacted.
You can start over and play the tutorial again, for the "normal" ending, which you were about to reach.
Or, since you were near the end anyway, you can start a new game and begin your journey proper!
string.Value:
You have a few options now. You can roll with it and continue in this world where Mehmet's been revenge-slain. The early game will be a bit harder, but the main quest is not impacted.
You can start over and play the tutorial again, for the "normal" ending, which you were about to reach.
Or, since you were near the end anyway, you can start a new game and begin your journey proper!

string.ID:
Whatever you choose, good luck, and feel free to return here for a refresher.
Live and drink.
string.Value:
Whatever you choose, good luck, and feel free to return here for a refresher.

string.ID:
Quetzal! That's all for the tutorial, friend.
We just scratched the very tip of the surface. Quests, secrets, leveling up, physics, reputation, limbs... we leave that for you to discover.
string.Value:
Quetzal! That's all for the tutorial, friend.

string.ID: You're ready to continue the journey on your own, but don't hesitate to play the tutorial again if you need a refresher.

All actions are turn-based, meaning you take a turn, then other creatures take a turn. For the most part, creatures won't act until you do.
If you ever get panicked, just slow down and consider your next move. There's no rush.

string.ID:
Whoever this was, they had some books. All books can be read in game.
Books with {{Y|white}} titles are generated and usually contain nonsense, but the nonsense can occasionally be useful.
Books with {{W|gold}} titles are more valuable: they are handwritten by in-world beings and contain interesting takes on the world.

Whoever this was, they had some books. All books can be read in game.
Books with {{Y|white}} titles are generated and usually contain nonsense, but the nonsense can occasionally be useful.
Books with {{W|gold}} titles are more valuable: they are handwritten by in-world beings and contain interesting takes on the world.

string.ID: This water is valuable too. Take it all.

quests.string: This water is valuable too. Take it all.

string.ID:
Welcome to the Caves of Qud tutorial. We'll just be scratching the surface here, learning enough of the basics to help you get your footing.
In Caves of Qud, you play as a mutated human or true kin.
For the tutorial, we're picking mutated human.
string.Value:
Welcome to the Caves of Qud tutorial. We'll just be scratching the surface here, learning enough of the basics to help you get your footing.
In Caves of Qud, you play as a mutated human or true kin.
For the tutorial, we're picking mutated human.

string.ID:
Character creation is a deep and sometimes long process. We included some preset builds to help you get started. After the tutorial, you can try another build, or make a character from scratch. (The recommended way! Once you get your footing.)
For now, pick the marsh taur.
string.Value:
Character creation is a deep and sometimes long process. We included some preset builds to help you get started. After the tutorial, you can try another build, or make a character from scratch. (The recommended way! Once you get your footing.)
For now, pick the marsh taur.

string.ID: Here is a summary of your attributes and mutations, which grant your character unique abilities.

quests.string: Here is a summary of your attributes and mutations, which grant your character unique abilities.

string.ID: You can name your character or choose Next for a random name.

quests.string: You can name your character or choose Next for a random name.

string.ID: On the 30th of Kisu Ux, you scuttle down a dark shaft at the edge of a sunken trade path and arrive at a caravanserai. It's powdered in salt and dust from across the ribbon of time.

quests.string: On the 30th of Kisu Ux, you scuttle down a dark shaft at the edge of a sunken trade path and arrive at a caravanserai. It's powdered in salt and dust from across the ribbon of time.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest dialog
string.ID: They are disciples of Barathrum. Mostly they are Urshiib, like their mentor. Mutant albino cave bears. With quills to boot! A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the heart of Qud. He has spent centuries fiddling with the tokens of antiquity in his underground workshops.

quests.string: They are disciples of Barathrum. Mostly they are Urshiib, like their mentor. Mutant albino cave bears. With quills to boot! A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the heart of Qud. He has spent centuries fiddling with the tokens of antiquity in his underground workshops.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest choice
string.ID: I will take the disk to Grit Gate and speak with the Barathrumites.

quests.string: I will take the disk to Grit Gate and speak with the Barathrumites.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest choice deny
string.ID: I must pass on this offer, for now. Live and drink.

quests.string: I must pass on this offer, for now. Live and drink.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest restart dialog
string.ID:
Are you seeking more work, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Recently we came into possession of a data disk bearing a peculiar stamp and encoded with a strange signal. The signal means nothing to us, but there's a sect of tinkers called the Barathrumites who might be interested in it. They are friends to our village and often trade for the scrap we tow out of the earth. Would you carry the disk to their enclave at Grit Gate, along the western rim of the jungle? In exchange for the delivery, you might seek an apprenticeship with them.
If you are interested, take the disk now, and travel safely.

Catch a disease early enough and you can kill it.~"Ease the pain, addle the brain." Be careful when you chew witchwood bark.~In the market for a tonic, =player.formalAddressTerm=?
